Content: Vanguard Junrock
Tacet Discord commonly seen active within mines and mountainous areas, small in size, relatively low danger level.

Binomial name "Resinacrustidum lapis", member of the Resinacrustidum species. This Tacet Discord is often found active in packs within mines and mountainous areas, along with other Fission Junrocks, relatively low danger level.
Fission Junrock
A Resinacrustidum species of small size Tacet Discords, often found active in packs. Mainly appears in areas with abundant rock masses. Danger level relatively low.
Binomial name "Resinacrustidum lapis", part of the Resinacrustidum species. This Tacet Discord is often found active, along with Vanguard Junrocks, relatively low danger level.
Impulse Predator
Tacet Discord whose appearance resembles that of a human, has specialized upper limbs that can use conducto energy for long-range attacks. According to witnesses, and is somewhat dangerous.

<color=#9656d8>[Conducto]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Conducto DMG</color>.

Scientifically named the "Devorsonidum impulsio", Devourer specis. The left upper limb of the Impulse Predators has evolved into a bow and arrow, which can gather conductive energy to shoot at longer distances.
Fusion Warrior
The appearance of this Tacet Discord resembles a humanoid, widely distributed. The attacks are mainly at close range and are dangerous.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum fusio", a member of the genus Devorsonidum. Bilateral upper limbs resemble long and short spears respectively, and can attack by stabbing and chopping. Moderate danger level.
Rupture Warrior
A humanoid Tacet Discord with a wide distribution that mainly attacks at close range. Possesses unilateral idiosyncratic upper extremity, with some risk.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum ruptura", a member of the genus Disorder. Its appearance resembles that of a human, with a strong desire to attack and a certain degree of danger.
Rocksteady Guardian
Widespread humanoid TDs, according to eyewitnesses, have specialized arms, attack mainly at close range and are dangerous.
Binomial name "Devorsonidum spectrum", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
Tic Tac
A common small Tacet Discord that can release a small amount of Havoc energy to attack. Relatively low danger level.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Strepoplasmidum ruptura", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Can use Havoc energy in simple ways to attacks, possesses no intelligence.
Whiff Whoosh
A common small Tacet Discord that can release a small amount of Aero energy to attack. Relatively low danger level.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Strepoplasmidum spiritalis", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Possesses no intelligence, due to the Aero energy mass gathered in its "head" emitting sound similar to that of a gust of wind, hence the name "Whiff Whoosh".
Snip Snap
A common small size Tacet Discord that can release a small amount of Fusion energy to attack. Relatively low danger level.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Strepoplasmidum fusio", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Does not possess any intelligence, due of its plier-shape body, occasionally called the "plier beast".
Zig Zag
A common small Tacet Discord that can releas a small amount of Spectra energy to attack. Relatively low danger level.
Scientifically named the "Strepoplasmidum spectrum", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Gained its name due to the lack of intelligence and simple behavioral logic.
Pneuma Predator
The appearance of this TD resembles a hunter with a bowler hat on his head, appearing in Tacet Fields everywhere, with a special long-range attack and a certain degree of danger.

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum spiritalis", a member of the genus Devorsonidum. The Aero Predator's throwing weapon is part of its body structure, and can be recovered using its own Aerotic energy after being thrown.
Glacio Predator
A common humanoid TD found in Tacet Fields of across the world. According to eyewitnesses, it resembles a hunter in a cloak and can use Glacio energy for long-range attacks. Moderate danger level.

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum glacies", Devourer specis, has evolved a body structure similar to a human "cape", which is presumed to gather condensation energy more quickly to form a "projectile "long-range attack.
Spectra Prism
According to sighting reports, this TD is often found in Tacetite vein systems and can cause Spectra damage.

[Spectra] It preserves immunity to Spectra DMG. Spectra Prism is resinacrustidum species of Tacet Discord. It can absorb photon with its special mineral crust and preserve the energy for Spectra laser attack. Several years ago, the number of Spectra Prisms increased rapidly in a nation, and the people claimed they can be used for illuminations, which in the end was resulted in 10 thousands of accidents. "Should be forbidden to use for illuminations", excerpt from How to Put Echoes into Use ...New Federation edition.
Glacio Prism
According to sighting reports, this TD is often found in Tacetite vein systems and can cause Glacio damage.

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>immunity</color> to <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Glacio Prism is resinacrustidum species of Tacet Discord. Its crust can absorb heat near itself and then attack with Glacio air. Part of Huanglong's residents hate them the most, cause their names in Huanglong official language are hard to pronounce correctly.
Havoc Prism
According to sighting reports, this TD is often found in Tacetite vein systems and can cause Havoc damage.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>immunity </color>to <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

It was questioned to be resinacrustidum species of Tacet Discord in New Federation and Duvia. Duvia scholars claimed they're just converged energy appeared in the mimic form of other Prisms. Speaking of Duvia, this nation has a legend says gathering all Prisms will conjure miracles... Should one try it out?
Fusion Prism
According to sighting reports, this TD is often found in Tacetite vein systems and can cause Fusion damage.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>immunity</color> to <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Fusion Prism is resinacrustidum species of Tacet Discord. High temperature environment is the reason they evolved with heat adjustment ability. Their crusts are similar to the structure of volcanic rock, which help them to preserve more fusion energy. People in Huanglong find it hard to figure out why they cannot melt themselves.
Chasm Guardian
This type of TD is visible in multiple regions, with unilateral upper limb idiosyncrasy, similar to a human raising a shield with one hand, and is dangerous

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum ruptura", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
Stonewall Bracer
Commonly found in mountainous hills and other places of human-like TDs, widely distributed, with a certain degree of danger.
Binomial name "Resinacrustidum lapis", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum.
Flute Instrumentalist
Human-like TD, widely distributed and visible in multiple regions. According to eyewitnesses, the attack is similar to humans playing wind instruments and is somewhat dangerous.

<color=#9656d8>[Conducto]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Conducto DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum impulsio", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
Tambourine Instrumentalist

Such TDs are widely distributed and visible in multiple regions. Sighting reports indicate that they are capable of influencing the actions of opponents through special attacks and are somewhat dangerous.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum ruptura", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
Gulpuff
Small aquatic Mutant Organism, mostly found in freshwater networks, seem to have a habit of sneaking up on their prey and are less dangerous.

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Tetraodon lateo", a Mutant Organism of the genus Tetraodon.
Violet-Feathered Heron

Large Mutant Organism unique to Huanglong, often found in the Huanglong territory between the wetlands and lakes. Desorock Highlands also have their traces, aggressive and territorial awareness is very strong, there is a certain degree of danger.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Ardea purpurea bipenna", a subspecies of Ardea purpurea uniquely found in Huanglong.
Cyan-Feathered Heron
One of the large waders endemic to Huanglong. It is ferocious in nature and is mostly found in the waters of Huanglong and the Desorock Highlands, and is somewhat dangerous.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Ardea purpurea bipenna", a subspecies of Ardea purpurea uniquely found in Huanglong.
Cruisewing
Commonly found in the territories within Huanglong, the existing sightings report that it only appears in the daytime. Relatively low danger level.

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#d4bf5f>immunity</color> to <color=#b49f50>Spectra DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Acanthacorydalis squapenna", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum. Commonly found on waterfronts in warm and humid areas throughout Huanglong. Although slightly aggressive, they are easily preyed upon by Geohide Saurians and others, and are not very dangerous. Relatively low danger level.
Sabyr Boar
A medium-sized Mutant Organism with a violent temperament. Terrestrial, mostly living in groups, good at running and rushing, widely distributed. Relatively low danger level.

Binomial name "Babyrousa fractden", a Mutant Organism the genus Babyrousa. An omnivore Mutant Organism commonly seen everywhere. Although its diet is mainly of vegetative origin, but the temperament is unlike the ordinary herbivores.
Excarat
Small boar-like Mutant Organism common within Huanglong, they are easily found in warmer areas during the day. Relatively low danger level.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Myospalax actinoaftia", a Mutant Organism the genus Myospalax. A common small rodent Mutant Organism, mostly found in grasslands or temperate forests and mountains.
Geohide Saurian Minor
Mostly seen as juvenile reptiles in the Desorock Highlands. According to witnesses, it usually follows the adults and hunts in concert, which is dangerous.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Aigialosauridae lapis", a Mutant Organism the genus Aigialosauridae. The lizards have no natural habit of caring for their younglings, thus hatchlings can only survive by imitating the hunting behavior of the adults, scavenging the remains of their food and, if necessary, using other hatchlings as targets for prey.
Geohide Saurian Major
The Mutant Organism is mostly found in the Desorock Highlands. According to witnesses, it is a large reptile, fast action, more dangerous.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Aigialosauridae lapis", a Mutant Organism of the genus Aigialosauridae.
Roseshroom (Immature)
Mature stage mutant plant, widely distributed worldwide, prefers wet areas with more Tacetites. Relatively low danger level.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Agaricus mimetikos", a Mutant Organism the genus Agaricus. In its immatured stage, the Roseshroom does not yet possess the ability to absorb nutrients from Tacetites, thus needing to gather nutrients from nearby matured Roseshrooms in order to survive.
Roseshroom (Mature)
Widely distributed mutant plants, mostly found in areas with more Tacetite, less dangerous.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Agaricus mimicus". Prefers shade and humidity, tend to gather in groups of two or three in west caves rich in Tacetite.
Rupture Dreadmane Major
A widely distributed canidae with numerous subspecies. This subspecies appears to have evolved specifically for Havoc properties. Posses a danger levels of certain degree.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Chrysocyon brachyurus terreo". Adult Dreadmanes are larger in size, ambulant and nocturnal, and lives in packs, with strong social and aggressive characteristics.
Fusion Dreadmane Minor

A widely distributed juvenile canidae with numerous subspecies, usually following the adults around in groups. This subspecies appears to have evolved specificity for fusion property and is less dangerous.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Chrysocyon brachyurus terreo", a Mutant Organism the subspecies Chrysocyon brachyurus.
Exile Commoner
Dangerous individuals roaming the wilderness of various nations, mostly operating in groups, appearing in groups, easy to deal with singly. Relatively low danger level.

The name "Exile" bears an unforgivable felony. They can not enter towns, thus left wandering in the wilderness. Although most of the Exiles only paid for their past misdeeds, considering that not all trials in various nations are "fair", there are quite a number who were wrongfully exiled and are rebelling with a sense of fury in mind
Exile Leader
Leaders of the outlaws, usually found in the Exile Campgrounds across the world, has more combat experience and skills than the average Exile, and are somewhat dangerous.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Exile Leaders are mostly Resonators. In the Huanglong region, for example, the Exile Leaders are usually those who have been expelled from the Mornguard for various reasons, and their combat experience and abilities cannot be compared with those of ordinary Exiles.
Hooscamp

Primate larvae unique to the Dim Forest. Multiple sighting reports indicate that they often move with the adults and have relatively high intelligence, but are less mobile and less dangerous than the adults.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Hoolock vexo", a Mutant Organism the genus Hoolock. Hooscamps, though physically incomparable to the more adult Hoochiefs, but the intellectual development has been no different, the Hoochiefs tends to teach Hooscamps to hunt and ambush passers-by in the Dim Forest.
Cyrscorpion

Small Mutant Organism, widely distributed, with different subspecies reported in various regions, mostly found in caves, mines and other dark and humid places around the world, with a low level of danger.
The Cyrscorpion is one of the few Mutant Organisms that shares the same common name and scientific classification.
Hoochief

Mutant Organism unique to the Dim Forest. Multiple sighting reports show that such Mutant Organisms are relatively high in intelligence, have strong ability to act cooperatively, capable of group combat, and are somewhat dangerous.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Hoolock vexo". There are only sightings in the Dim Forest, Mutant Organism with the highest level of intelligence found in Huanglong. According to the observation records, they seems to live in a kind of complex social relationship similar to primitive tribes. They're domineering in Dim Forest, and will attack and plunder humans in Dim Forest initiatively. And that's why people in Huanglong would call them gangster with no words.
Spearback Ursa
Large Mutant Organism inhabiting the Huanglong Forest, usually moving in small groups of 3-5, with a keen sense of smell and a certain degree of danger.
Trinomial name "Ursus spelaeus sagispina", mainly found inhabiting the Huanglong Forest. This Mutant Organism has poor eyesight and relies mainly on hearing for hunting.
Chaserazor
Tacet Discord unique to the Dim Forest. Sighting reports and insurance claims state that it has a strong desire to hunt and attack, and is presumed to be dangerous.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Part of th artificial species, only found in the Dim Forest. Th Tacet Discord usually uses abandoned vehicles as a host shell, and moves quickly, and once it has set eyes on its prey, it will never give up, hence the name "wind chasing blade scythe". This claim is not very credible, according to the analysis of this equipment, most likely because the prey chased by it fled as fast as the "wind".
Legion Hammer
Regular melee combat union in the Legion. They can be seen in most places. Their slow movement makes them easy to be dealt with.

The abnormal figure of Legion Hammer is the result of Fractsidus's experiment and transformation. This figure provides them with extremely strong power to wield the hammer or to protect their teammate with bodies. Most of them has been through a despair time before they got in the experiment. Fractsidus took them in and provide them a salvation with price.
Fractsidus Executioner
Regular melee combat union in the Legion. They can be seen in most places. Their slow movement makes them easy to be dealt with.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

The abnormal figure of Legion Hammer is the result of Fractsidus's experiment and transformation. This figure provides them with extremely strong power to wield the hammer or to protect their teammate with bodies. Most of them has been through a despair time before they got in the experiment. Fractsidus took them in and provide them a salvation with price.
Thunder Squama
A powerful Tacet Discord that appears in the Tacet Field of Desorock Highlands and is capable of using the power of the Conducto.

<color=#9656d8>[Conducto]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Conducto DMG</color>.

The Thunder Squama resembles the fusion of a human and a lizard. It is able to use Wutherons within the Tacet Field for high-speed maneuvers. Initially, it is judged to be the result of the natural evolution of TDs. Huanglong's legend has it, "It devoured a couple for life. Tasted their sorrow and the will to fight, finally, the Thunder Squama was born from thunder." No one knows where this legend comes from.
Inferno Rider
A powerful Tacet Discord located in the Forsaken Abundance, According to witnesses, its movement is different from other TDs, more information to be further researched.

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

The usual Tacet Discords does not require a "vehicle" for movement, but the appearance of the Inferno Rider resembles a rider on a motorcycle, presumably this form is derived from a poor imitation of human behavior. The TD's crazy rampage in the "vehicle" is secretly known as "Flames of Fury" by Huanglong. While people in Huanglong have it, "Even the flames of fury will one day extinct." So guess Huanglong can always get people's hope up.
Gleamtender
Powerful Tacet Discord that reside in the deep shafts of the Tiger's Maw. There's very few available sighting reports, all of which claiming that they resemble insects.

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

The Gleamtender is a collection of small insect-like TDs called "Glowflies" that are highly sensitive to different sound frequencies. It can determine the location of prey by sound, and can also absorb and imitate their frequency. Oh by the way. This one can mimic their sounds.
Feilian Beringal
A formidable Mutant Organism deep in the Dim Forest. Leader of the Hoochiefs.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#46c3d4>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Once a tool of amusement for humans, later being hunted and became a nuisance for humans, imprisoned in the forest. It learned to use the pillar as its weapon and commanding the hoolock vexo. And use all has been done to him onto the human captured. So... Who's the one in cage actually?
Mourning Aix
A formidable Tacet Discord that nested in the Whining Aix's Mire, its wailing is called the "Never-ending elegy" by the people of Huanglong.

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

The Mourning Aix is elegant in form, bearing a bird-like appearance. Originally found in pairs, however, the other aix was defeated by the humans, with its remains forming a "pillar" where the Mourning Aix nests itself. It's a kind of evolution of TDs, People in Huanglong call it â€œWings Tunning". Quite romantic actually.
Crownless

A Tacet Discord observed in the Central Plains, there has been only sighting report for this TD, that of which from the Rover. There is no detailed record of its full appearance, and it is judged to be extremely dangerous according to its energy level.

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

A copy of the Threnodian "Crownless". It resembles a white-armored knight in appearance, and when risen in power, it extends its blood-red wings, presumably because it briefly manipulates the structure of Wutherons in its body, instantly increasing its mobility and attack power. Recently, it has also been observed that it can produce a body structure that mimics human "weapons". We don't know how far can it keep mutating. One thing is certain that it preserves the power of Havoc energy, quite the opposite to its looks. "Don't judge a TD by its cover". Adapted from Huanglong's idioms.
Bell-Borne Geochelone
Large Mutant Organism hidden deep in the Gorges of Spirit, deemed to be extremely dangerous. There is no detailed record of its full appearance yet.

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

The ancient bell on the back of the Geochelone hides its Tacetreite core, which resonates with the core when struck, exploding into a sound wave of Glacio energy. This sound wave can deal permanent damage to broca area in human brains and cause permanent aphasia. Good thing that with current medical technology, we have 0.04% chance to cure the damage.
Chirpuff
A low-risk Mutant Organism with a peculiar activity pattern that is commonly found in the waters of Whining Aix's Mire.

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Tetraodon spiritalis", a Mutant Organism of the genus Tetraodon. Theorieds suggests it is a relative to the Gurglepuff, but the ecological zones of the two are slightly different. Chirpuffs always float above in the midair and prey on various insects. Fishermen would take advantage of their habit to capture them with fake bait. Huanglong has Chirpuff as an idioms to refer someone has been taken advantage of.
Frostbite Tertoise
Terrestrial Mutant Organism, mostly found in the Gorges of Spirit. Some sightings have also been reported in places such as the Whining Aix's Mire, and the danger is not high.

<color=#1891e7>Glacio</color> This enemy has a <color=#b49f50>rather high resistance</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Its scientific name is 'Frostbite Tortoise', a mutant organism of terrestrial reptiles. It exhibits a violent temperament, often provoking and rushing towards creatures larger in size. It remains unclear whether this behavior is linked to its mutation. In Huanglong, tortoises are typically associated with calmness and sophistication, except for the Frostbite Tortoise.
